conclusion: Car A accelerates linearly from 0 m/s to 40 m/s in 10 s, then travels at constant speed 40 m/s.
Car B accelerates uniformly from 0 m/s at t = 0 to 40 m/s at t = 20 s and continues to accelerate at the same rate, reaching 60 m/s at t = 30 s.
Acceleration of Car B is determined as a_B = 2 m/s².
Velocity of Car B for any time t (0–30 s) is v_B = 2t m/s.
Position function for Car A from 0–10 s is x_A = 2t² m.
Position function for Car A from 10–30 s is x_A = 200 + 40(t-10).
Position function for Car B from 0–30 s is x_B = t² m.
Cars are side by side at t = 0 s and t = 20 s.
It is given they are also side-by-side at t = 30 s.
Relative separation between t = 0 and t = 20 s is calculated.
For 0–10 s, separation Δx increases from 0 m to 100 m.
For 10–20 s, separation Δx decreases steadily from 100 m to 0 m.
Maximum distance is the peak 100 m reached at t = 10 s.
